titles.title: The World Is Not My Home

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
The world is not my home;
I'm just passing through.
My treasures are laid up, somewhere beyond the blue.
O, the angels beckon me, from heaven's open door,
And I can't feel at home in this world anymore.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
O Lord, You know I have no friend like You;
If heaven's not my home, then, Lord, what would I do?
O, the angels beckon me, from heaven's open door,
And I can't feel at home in this world anymore.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Well, over in glory land, there is no dying there.
There are saints on every hand; there's always time for prayer.
The angels beckon me, from heaven's open door,
And I can't feel at home in this world anymore.
